channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PAConv: Position Adaptive Convolution with Dynamic Kernel Assembling on Point Clouds
item.description: The key of PAConv is to construct the convolution kernel by dynamically assembling basic weight matrices stored in Weight Bank, where the coefficients of these weight matrices are self-adaptively learned from point positions through ScoreNet.

item.title: LLM.int8(): 8-bit Matrix Multiplication for Transformers at Scale
item.description: We develop a procedure for Int8 matrix multiplication for feed-forward and attention projection layers in transformers, which cut the memory needed for inference by half while retaining full precision performance.

item.title: A Library for Representing Python Programs as Graphs for Machine Learning
item.description: Graph representations of programs are commonly a central element of machine learning for code research.

item.title: Musika! Fast Infinite Waveform Music Generation
item.description: We release the source code and pretrained autoencoder weights at github. com/marcoppasini/musika, such that a GAN can be trained on a new music domain with a single GPU in a matter of hours.

item.title: OCR-free Document Understanding Transformer
item.description: Current Visual Document Understanding (VDU) methods outsource the task of reading text to off-the-shelf Optical Character Recognition (OCR) engines and focus on the understanding task with the OCR outputs.

item.title: Flow-Guided Transformer for Video Inpainting
item.description: Especially in spatial transformer, we design a dual perspective spatial MHSA, which integrates the global tokens to the window-based attention.

item.title: Can Language Models Make Fun? A Case Study in Chinese Comical Crosstalk
item.description: However, the humor aspect of natural language is relatively under-investigated, especially in the age of pre-trained language models.

item.title: StyleFaceV: Face Video Generation via Decomposing and Recomposing Pretrained StyleGAN3
item.description: Notably, StyleFaceV is capable of generating realistic $1024\times1024$ face videos even without high-resolution training videos.

item.title: Paint2Pix: Interactive Painting based Progressive Image Synthesis and Editing
item.description: In particular, we propose a novel approach paint2pix, which learns to predict (and adapt) "what a user wants to draw" from rudimentary brushstroke inputs, by learning a mapping from the manifold of incomplete human paintings to their realistic renderings.

item.title: TotalSegmentator: robust segmentation of 104 anatomical structures in CT images
item.description: Finally, we train a segmentation algorithm on this new dataset.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Alpa: Automating Inter- and Intra-Operator Parallelism for Distributed Deep Learning
item.description: Existing model-parallel training systems either require users to manually create a parallelization plan or automatically generate one from a limited space of model parallelism configurations.

item.title: DeepNet: Scaling Transformers to 1,000 Layers
item.description: In this paper, we propose a simple yet effective method to stabilize extremely deep Transformers.

item.title: Text-Guided Synthesis of Artistic Images with Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models
item.description: In RDMs, a set of nearest neighbors is retrieved from an external database during training for each training instance, and the diffusion model is conditioned on these informative samples.

item.title: Instant Neural Graphics Primitives with a Multiresolution Hash Encoding
item.description: Neural graphics primitives, parameterized by fully connected neural networks, can be costly to train and evaluate.

item.title: Learning to Count Anything: Reference-less Class-agnostic Counting with Weak Supervision
item.description: While there are class-agnostic counting methods that can generalise to unseen classes, these methods require reference images to define the type of object to be counted, as well as instance annotations during training.

item.title: FedDM: Iterative Distribution Matching for Communication-Efficient Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning~(FL) has recently attracted increasing attention from academia and industry, with the ultimate goal of achieving collaborative training under privacy and communication constraints.

item.title: Delving into Effective Gradient Matching for Dataset Condensation
item.description: In this work, we delve into the gradient matching method from a comprehensive perspective and answer the critical questions of what, how, and where to match.

item.title: Multi-scale Multi-band DenseNets for Audio Source Separation
item.description: This paper deals with the problem of audio source separation.

item.title: HorNet: Efficient High-Order Spatial Interactions with Recursive Gated Convolutions
item.description: In this paper, we show that the key ingredients behind the vision Transformers, namely input-adaptive, long-range and high-order spatial interactions, can also be efficiently implemented with a convolution-based framework.
